author: lightclient
content:
i'm not sure why, but i'm having some issues getting 1559 txs mined
* i created a tx locally with a feecap of `14` and a tip of `1`
* the tx was propagated over the wire to the quilt bootnode
* doesn't seem to be getting picked up by the signer
any ideas?

content: tx hash: `0x118596fae11257a04fd97bf5dc42f7ba05b847cf451ebfcf9987f66b2f7147b9`

author: sunce86.
content: +1. Guess there is low limit for "tip" for a transaction to be included in a block for some of the active clients...?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Well the somewhat weird part is that the first 1559 txn has a tip of only 2 iirc. But maybe thats because its a private txn and the signer will just mine it regardless.

author: sunce86.

author: sunce86.

author: sunce86.

author: matkt0
content: It's POA so you just have to give me your public key and I'll add you as a signer

author: sunce86.

author: sunce86.
content: Btw my public key is 0x004385d8be6140e6f889833f68b51e17b6eacb29

author: jochembrouwer
content: Coinbase in POA is always 0x00

author: yuga.eth
content: Anybody working on the 1559 JSON RPCs have an answer to this question? https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/jsonrpc-changes-for-type-0x2-eip-1559-transactions/6101/6?u=yuga.cb

author: sunce86.
content: For OE, getTransactionByHash returns only maxPriorityFeePerGas and maxFeePerGas, with no "intermediate values" like effective_gas_price. Intermediate values are basically redundant since you can easily rebuild them (as you already commented).

author: yuga.eth
content: I see, so it will be up to the client to reconstruct those values based on the block base fee.

author: sunce86.
content: Yup, unless different consensus agreement is achieved between clients in the meantime... Its WIP still

author: yuga.eth
content: OK, got it! Thank you!
